## isValidPlugin() function

> This API is provided as an alpha preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.
> 

Type guard to check if a value is a valid ChangeDetectorPlugin.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function isValidPlugin(plugin: unknown): plugin is ChangeDetectorPlugin;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

plugin


</td><td>

unknown


</td><td>

The value to check


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

plugin is [ChangeDetectorPlugin](./change-detector-core.changedetectorplugin.md)

True if the value is a valid plugin

## Remarks

This is a convenience function that combines validation with type narrowing. For detailed error information, use `validatePlugin()` directly.

## Example


```typescript
if (isValidPlugin(loadedModule)) {
  // loadedModule is typed as ChangeDetectorPlugin
  registry.register(loadedModule);
}
```
